strong_typedef.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_STRONG_TYPEDEF_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_STRONG_TYPEDEF_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // strong_typedef.hpp:
00011 
00012 // (C) Copyright 2002 Robert Ramey - http://www.rrsd.com . 
00013 // Use, modification and distribution is subject to the Boost Software
00014 // License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at
00015 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00016 
00017 //  See http://www.boost.org/libs/serialization for updates, documentation, and revision history.
00018 
00019 // macro used to implement a strong typedef.  strong typedef
00020 // guarentees that two types are distinguised even though the
00021 // share the same underlying implementation.  typedef does not create
00022 // a new type.  BOOST_STRONG_TYPEDEF(T, D) creates a new type named D
00023 // that operates as a type T.
00024 
00025 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00026 #include <boost/operators.hpp>
00027 
00028 #if !defined(__BORLANDC__) || __BORLANDC__ >= 0x590
00029     #define BOOST_STRONG_TYPEDEF(T, D)                              \
00030     struct D                                                        \
00031         : boost::totally_ordered1< D                                \
00032         , boost::totally_ordered2< D, T                             \
00033         > >                                                         \
00034     {                                                               \
00035         T t;                                                        \
00036         explicit D(const T t_) : t(t_) {};                          \
00037         D(){};                                                      \
00038         D(const D & t_) : t(t_.t){}                                 \
00039         D & operator=(const D & rhs) { t = rhs.t; return *this;}    \
00040         D & operator=(const T & rhs) { t = rhs; return *this;}      \
00041         operator const T & () const {return t; }                    \
00042         operator T & () { return t; }                               \
00043         bool operator==(const D & rhs) const { return t == rhs.t; } \
00044         bool operator<(const D & rhs) const { return t < rhs.t; }   \
00045     };
00046 #else
00047     #define BOOST_STRONG_TYPEDEF(T, D)                              \
00048     struct D                                                        \
00049         : boost::totally_ordered1< D                                \
00050         , boost::totally_ordered2< D, T                             \
00051         > >                                                         \
00052     {                                                               \
00053         T t;                                                        \
00054         explicit D(const T t_) : t(t_) {};                          \
00055         D(){};                                                      \
00056         D(const D & t_) : t(t_.t){}                                 \
00057         D & operator=(const D & rhs) { t = rhs.t; return *this;}    \
00058         D & operator=(const T & rhs) { t = rhs; return *this;}      \
00059         /*operator const T & () const {return t; }*/                \
00060         operator T & () { return t; }                               \
00061         bool operator==(const D & rhs) const { return t == rhs.t; } \
00062         bool operator<(const D & rhs) const { return t < rhs.t; }   \
00063     };
00064 #endif // !defined(__BORLANDC) || __BORLANDC__ >= 0x590
00065 
00066 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_STRONG_TYPEDEF_HPP
